commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Well? We've decided we're doing this, but what does a one-day train conductor actually do?

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: I thought you would know, Nico-chi.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Of course I don't know. What I wanted to be was a one-day station master!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Oh, that's right. Hmm...

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: What should we do?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Hey, you went out of your way to get a train, so you should have at least thought about that!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I think train conductors do a lot of things inside of the train.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Yes. To put it simply, their job is to make sure that their passengers have a comfortable ride.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I see. So that's all we have to do, then!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: No. Wrong.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Huh? Why? I thought we were going to be conductors.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Yes, but there's nothing school idol-like about that. It's not like us to simply copy a train conductor's duties.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: We're school idols acting as train conductors. There must be more we can do.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Hmm. Like wave to all the passengers?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: We can do that, but I think train conductors already do, too.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Indeed. If we want to do something more school idol-like, there must be another...

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: *Sigh* Honestly. I see you're all still hopeless without me.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Do you have some sort of idea, then?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Heh heh heh. A live show! We're school idols, so we should put on a live show!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: A live show? That sounds fun!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: But won't it be hard with the train moving? I wonder if it'll be okay.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: It'll be fine. That sort of thing just comes with putting on a live show. Let's do it!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Since we're train conductors for a day, how about having a live show all day, too?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: That's a bit much. We're train conductors, so we still have to carry out our conductor duties.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: No, that's the very least we can do, or we can't say we're school idols working as train conductors for a day!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Then it's decided. Let's have an all-day live show!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Are you serious? But we cannot neglect our conductor duties...

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: I can't wait! We have to start preparing right away.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Rina-chan Board says, "Woo-hoo! Heart-pounding."

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Girls, are you listening? We still have to carry out our train conductor duties. Understood?!
